content:
Hi CDS Hooks enthusiasts!

The HL7 FHIR Connectathon is this weekend in Madrid. In case you haven't booked your tickets yet, here's how you can participate remotely:

1) Check out the scenarios for the connectathon here: http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=201705_CDS_Hooks. Are you interesting in working on these?
2) Document your publically accessible CDS Hooks discovery endpoint at: https://bit.ly/cds-hooks-connectathon-tracking.
3) Check out the list of open issues at https://github.com/cds-hooks/docs/issues.
4) Participate in this zulip stream and the google group at https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/cds-hooks.
5) Badger the various EHRs/platforms to configure and test your services.
...
Profit!

Isaac Vetter

Hi everyone! In order to take advantage of everyone working on CDS Hooks at the Connectathon this weekend, we've created a page listing some issues of interest that we would love feedback on from the community. We of course welcome feedback on all issues but these are of particular importance given the makeup of the participants. :)

Hi All,

Ken and Phil from the University of Utah have offered to share their webex that they're using to participate remotely in the Connectathon that's starting now. If you need more than the zulip chat, you use use this webex.

Thanks, Ken and Phil!

Isaac

FHIR Connectathon - CDS Hooks
Sat, May 6, 2017 9:40 AM - 5:40 PM CEST

Please join my meeting from your computer, tablet or smartphone.
https://global.gotomeeting.com/join/232311869

You can also dial in using your phone.
United States: +1 (872) 240-3412

Access Code: 232-311-869

First GoToMeeting? Try a test session: https://care.citrixonline.com/g2m/getready
Here's a proposed security model for everyone to take a look at: https://github.com/cds-hooks/docs/wiki/Proposed-Security-Model

Thank you everyone who participated in person and remotely for the CDS Hooks track! I'll be uploading the slides from the presentation today and will post it along with a write-up/summary of what we did this weekend.
Here is the slide deck for our track summary
